p: Flowering phenology is affected by number, timing and duration of flowers [ 44]. These factors are not only constrained by genetics and phylogeny, but also affected by environmental conditions, such as sunlight, temperature, nutrients, and competition [ 42]. The present study found that flowering phenology of M. micrantha was significantly delayed, duration of flowering and fruiting was significantly reduced and duration of bud formation was markedly increased with increased sweet potato proportions.
